user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of try_get_value:
```c
static void
try_get_value (const char *buf,
               const char *key,
               char **destination)
{
  const char *spos;
  const char *bpos;
  const char *endv;
  size_t klen;
  size_t vlen;

  if (NULL != *destination)
    return;
  bpos = buf;
  klen = strlen (key);
  while (NULL != (spos = strstr (bpos, key)))
  {
    if ( (spos[klen] != '=') ||
         ( (spos != buf) &&
           (spos[-1] != ' ') ) )
    {
      /* no match */
      bpos = spos + 1;
      continue;
    }
    if (spos[klen + 1] != '"')
      return;                   /* not quoted */
    if (NULL == (endv = strchr (&spos[klen + 2],
                                '\"')))
      return;                   /* no end-quote */
    vlen = (size_t) (endv - spos) - klen - 1;
    *destination = malloc (vlen);
    if (NULL == *destination)
      return;                   /* out of memory */
    (*destination)[vlen - 1] = '\0';
    memcpy (*destination,
            &spos[klen + 2],
            vlen - 1);
    return;                     /* success */
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function try_get_value:
static int
process_multipart_headers (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                           size_t *ioffptr,
                           enum PP_State next_state)
{
  char *buf = (char *) &pp[1];
  size_t newline;

  newline = 0;
  while ( (newline < pp->buffer_pos) &&
          (buf[newline] != '\r') &&
          (buf[newline] != '\n') )
    newline++;
  if (newline == pp->buffer_size)
  {
    pp->state = PP_Error;
    return MHD_NO;              /* out of memory */
  }
  if (newline == pp->buffer_pos)
    return MHD_NO;              /* will need more data */
  if (0 == newline)
  {
    /* empty line - end of headers */
    pp->skip_rn = RN_Full;
    pp->state = next_state;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  /* got an actual header */
  if (buf[newline] == '\r')
    pp->skip_rn = RN_OptN;
  buf[newline] = '\0';
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ ("Content-disposition: ",
                                 buf,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")))
  {
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "name",
                   &pp->content_name);
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "filename",
                   &pp->content_filename);
  }
  else
  {
    try_match_header ("Content-type: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-type: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_type);
    try_match_header ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_transfer_encoding);
  }
  (*ioffptr) += newline + 1;
  return MHD_YES;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I found no uses of compiler language extensions in the provided code. Specifically:
- There are no compiler-specific keywords or built-ins such as __attribute__, __asm, __inline__ (as a compiler extension), __builtin_*, typeof, __extension__ or similar tokens.  
- There is no inline assembly, no use of nonstandard token-pasting, no unnamed struct/union extensions, and no other known nonstandard constructs in the shown fragments.  
- Pointer arithmetic, casts (e.g. (char *)&pp[1]), assignments inside conditions, standard library calls (strstr, strchr, strlen, malloc, memcpy) and the enum/struct usage are all standard C and not language extensions.

One caveat: I can only inspect the code you supplied. The macros and helper functions (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_, try_match_header, MHD_* return values, etc.) are invoked here but their definitions are not shown. If any of those macro or function definitions expand to or rely on compiler-specific extensions, those definitions would need to be inspected. Based on the visible code alone, however, there are no explicit language extensions to report.
